page.title: 15TRAVEL
page.content: The main travel in Flushing is the Ferry After the war in 1945 about 105 people would use the Flushing ferry to go to the docks,now only about 4 people use it.The ferry leaves the quay on the hour and the half hour. It arrives in Falmouth at quarter past the hour and quarter to the hour.The ferry starts at 8.00 a.m and finishes at 6.00 p.m.The ferry used to take 120 people but now only takes 12 people.It used to cost 1\d now it costs 40p each way. There are no buses to Falmouth from Flushing,there never has been.Flushing quay was first owned by the Lord Of The Manor the trefusis family.It was then sold to Parker and Llydd who spoilt the quay by letting big ships drop boulders in Flushing.They are now used as cobbled streets.
